alert.note: Alert for Seminole (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 29 at 10:45AM EDT until further notice by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Melbourne FL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Sanford affecting Seminole County. .The center of Tropical Storm Ian will emerge off of the Brevard County coast in the next hour, with historic rainfall of 12 to 18 inches reported across east central Florida. These amounts have already caused quick rises along the Saint Johns River. The forecast point at Sanford will soon reach Minor Flood Stage and continue to rise into early next week but remain below Moderate Stage. For the St. Johns River...including Sanford...Minor flooding is forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 215 AM EDT. && ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...St Johns River Near Sanford. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 6.5 feet, Water enters a few lower lying homes in the Stone Island and Stillbrook subdivisions. The road into Stone Island becomes impassable. Water rises onto low lying property near Sanford. Parks and docks are flooded near Lake Monroe. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 5.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to 6.5 feet early Monday afternoon. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 5.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (8 am) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Mon Tue St Johns River Sanford 5.5 5.5 Thu 9 am 5.9 6.1 6.3 6.4 6.5 &&
